Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Regarding Documentation of API reference -> Router constructor options " (#6836) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.5.2

### Reproduction link
[https://router.vuejs.org/en/api/options.html#routes](https://router.vuejs.org/en/api/options.html#routes)

### Steps to reproduce
In https://router.vuejs.org/en/api/options.html#routes , when I click provided link as "right arrow" ( > ) on right side of website, nothing redirects to "#routes" only and it doesn't processes to any other pages. In fact when viewing any other api reference such as mode or base then also it redirects to #routes. Also "left arrow" ( < ) is working fine when I visit The Router instance or The router object. But only right arrow is pointing to the first api reference in particular section

### What is expected?
Should redirect to provided source.

### What is actually happening?
Its redirecting to '#routes' section 

---
If its mean to redirecting to routes api reference, then arrow should be pointing upwards.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Failed to mount component: template or render function not defined." (#6835) at vuejs/vue
Opened issue "Failed to mount component: template or render function not defined." (#6835) at vuejs/vue
Closed issue "[Help!] Is there a way to embed external js scripts within a component?" (#6834) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
I'd like to embed the following script into my component in nuxtjs app. But since nuxt has no solution for this. I'd like to ask the vue community to see if there was a better way of embedding external 3rd party js scripts? 

Where should I be embedding this type of scipt? And what sort of external configurations do I need to add to enable this to work? 

```js
<script type="text/javascript" src="//downloads.mailchimp.com/js/signup-forms/popup/embed.js" data-dojo-config="usePlainJson: true, isDebug: false"></script><script type="text/javascript">require(["mojo/signup-forms/Loader"], function(L) { L.start({"baseUrl":"mc.us17.list-manage.com","uuid":"XXXXXX","lid":"XXXXXX"}) })</script>
```

Thanks!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Help!] Is there a way to embed external js scripts within a component?" (#6834) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
I'd like to embed the following script into my component in nuxtjs app. But since nuxt has no solution for this. I'd like to ask the vue community to see if there was a better way of embedding external 3rd party js scripts? 

Where should I be embedding this type of scipt? And what sort of external configurations do I need to add to enable this to work? 

```js
<script type="text/javascript" src="//downloads.mailchimp.com/js/signup-forms/popup/embed.js" data-dojo-config="usePlainJson: true, isDebug: false"></script><script type="text/javascript">require(["mojo/signup-forms/Loader"], function(L) { L.start({"baseUrl":"mc.us17.list-manage.com","uuid":"XXXXXX","lid":"XXXXXX"}) })</script>
```

Thanks!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Update navigation-guards.md" (#1823) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
<!--
Please make sure to read the Pull Request Guidelines:
https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines
-->

### What problem does this feature solve?
With vue-router 1.x, it was possible to see where a route had been redirected from using `router.currentRoute.redirectedFrom`. This was useful when server-side rendering, as you could send a 301 from the server instead of sending the HTML for the new page and then changing the URL on the client.

With 2.x, the property has gone and I can't find it anywhere. Has it been removed? If so, it would be great if it could come back!

Reason it was nice that it existed: https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/issues/968

### What does the proposed API look like?
`router.currentRoute.redirectedFrom === '/old-path'`

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Include hashtags in redirect paths" (#1821) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.7.0

### Reproduction link
[http://jsfiddle.net/xt02xun7/](http://jsfiddle.net/xt02xun7/)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Click on the `/foo` link.

### What is expected?
It redirects to `/redir`, with the hashtag still in the url.

### What is actually happening?
It can't find `/redir#bar`

---
I have a page which opens accordions by using hashtags, and I would like to include these hashtags in the vue routers redirect function like so: `{ path: '/foo', redirect: '/redir#bar' }`. 

Manually typing the url `/redir#bar` works.

It seems like the redirect tries to find the path `/redir#bar`, including the hashtag. What I would like to do is for it to redirect to the `/redir` path, with the hashtag `#bar` still in the URL, as if you would write the URL manually.

Is this possible?

Regards,

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Update api.md" (#998) at vuejs/vuex
Opened pull request "Fix export default in index.d.ts" (#1000) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
The default export in index.d.ts breaks in Typescript 2.6 with the error "The expression of an export assignment must be an identifier or qualified name in an ambient context."

This commit also adds a small test that uses the default export, since no test existed previously.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Typescript 2.6 errors on `export default` " (#999) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.0

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/pull/18444](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/pull/18444)

### Steps to reproduce
* git clone https://github.com/vuejs/vuex.git
* cd vuex
* npm install
* npm install typescript@next
* cd types
* tsc -p test/tsconfig.json

### What is expected?
No error.

### What is actually happening?
Error: The expression of an export assignment must be an identifier or qualified name in an ambient context.

---
This error is new in Typescript 2.6. It disallows the export of expressions, including object literals like `{ Store, install }`. We found this error when testing popular packages with Typescript 2.6 RC.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
